package.name: Auth
package.summary: The PEAR::Auth package provides methods for creating an authentication system using PHP.

release.notes: This is the initial independent release of the Auth package.

Improved a bunch of things:
* Renamed some internal functions to be more compliant to the coding standards * Moved some parts of the code to the storage container. * Fixed a bug with expire time. * Added maximum idle time, which is (unlike expire time) refreshed on every request. * Improved behaviour of Container/DB.php

* It is now possible to pass a third parameter to the constructor to pass user defined function to print the login form.
* Improved behaviour of the PEAR:DB storage container: One can now pass an array to the container to use more individual table layouts.
* Add function sessionValidThru(), that returns the time up to the session is valid.
* Beginning with this release, there is a proper documentation available. (See README.Auth for the location of it.)

This is the first stable version of PEAR::Auth.
Currently it features:
* Customized login functions.
* 3 different storage containers: database, text file, LDAP. Customized containers can be easily written.
* Via the function setShowLogin() it is possible to create sites that have an optional login function, that makes it possible to create parts of the site without authentication and the rest only when the user has been authenicated.
* idle- and expire time.

This release includes a new function setSessionname, that allows the user of the package to change the name of the session to a value different than default ("PHPSESSID"). This is useful, if one uses two different auth systems on the same domain.
